mods.note: OUTWARD TELEGRAM k \ ' N [This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty’s Government, and should be kept under Lock and Key.] T/ ' r ^ Y. 2002/ ,20/6/0 • 2405 [Cypher] DEPARTMENTAL No, 19^1 J FROM FOREIGN OFF I CE TO BANGKOK No.196 May 7th, 1941. R* Repeated to Cairo No.1433. b h b h b h 5-4o ^ Your telegram No. 283 [dated 6th May: interruption of air service in Iraq]: Air service at present is disconnected between Karachi and Cairo but it is hoped shortly to provide a connecting service. Bags should therefore continue to be sent as they would remain in safe custody during their detention.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 2405/41 'Question of Air Mail Bags during Iraq disturbances.'

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the British Minister in Siam [Thailand] and the Foreign Office, regarding the sending of air mail bags while disturbances in Iraq cause an interruption of the air service.
